events.message: The customer filed a claim reporting a collision involving their vehicle that occurred on the morning of May 1st.
After reviewing the initial report, the claim was categorised under auto accident due to involvement of the car and collision details.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage and process the auto accident claim for the customer.
The agent contacted the customer to acknowledge receipt of the auto accident claim and to provide next steps.
The customer was asked to submit photographs of the damaged vehicle and the police report related to the accident.
The customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photos of the car damage and the official police collision report.
Investigators began evaluating the claim documents, the accident circumstances, and vehicle damage to determine liability.
The investigation was completed with findings supporting the customer’s claim that the accident was not their fault.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering repairs for the vehicle damage caused by the auto accident.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the prompt handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved for settlement payment based on the investigation and customer’s acceptance.
Payment for the vehicle repair was issued to the customer promptly after the claim approval, ensuring quick resolution.
The auto accident claim was closed successfully following confirmation of payment and customer satisfaction.
All claim documents and case files were archived in the system for future reference and compliance records.
